== Ubuntu Nordic ==

We're planning to do some collaboration in the Nordic countries (Denmark, Finland, Iceland, Norway, Sweden) to spread Ubuntu and help writing documentation and other things. Everything is still very new so we're open for new ideas. Please join some of the forums or the irc-channel ''#ubuntu-nordic''.

=== Communication ===
* IRC: ''#ubuntu-nordic''@freenode -irc channel (<nowiki>[[http://webchat.freenode.net/?channels=ubuntu-nordic|webchat]]</nowiki>) <<BR>>
* IRC for developers: ''#ubuntu-nordic-dev''@freenode -irc channel (<nowiki>[[http://webchat.freenode.net/?channels=ubuntu-nordic-dev|webchat]]</nowiki>) <<BR>>
* Launchpad: https://launchpad.net/~ubuntu-nordic  <<BR>>
* '''Join the mailing list''': https://lists.ubuntu.com/mailman/listinfo/Ubuntu-nordic <<BR>>
* See also https://mail.fsfeurope.org/mailman/listinfo/fsfe-nordic

=== Ubuntu Nordic Remix ===
Ubuntu Nordic Remix is a cd image that includes better Nordic language support than the original Ubuntu CD.

See <nowiki>[[http://www.danielnylander.se/2010/04/29/ubuntu-10-04-lucid-nordic-remix-edition-med-fullstandigt-sprakstod/|Ubuntu Nordic Remix 10.04]]</nowiki>
